ranges.notes: Public holiday, most businesses closed, recovery from New Year's Eve celebrations, winter atmosphere around Vrijthof Square
Winter sales begin, cold weather, few tourists, good time for museum visits like Bonnefanten Museum and excellent opportunity to explore the city without crowds
Cold winter weather continues, quiet tourism period, excellent time for museums and indoor attractions
Vibrant pre-Lenten celebration with parades, costumes, music, and festivities throughout the city; one of the biggest carnival celebrations in the Netherlands
Post-carnival recovery period, city returns to normal rhythm, good time for museum visits and indoor activities

ranges.event: TEFAF Maastricht (The European Fine Art Fair)
ranges.notes: World-renowned art and antiques fair attracting collectors, curators, and art enthusiasts from around the globe; city buzzes with cultural events
Early spring with unpredictable weather, gradual warming, indoor-outdoor activities begin
Spring arrives, flowers begin to bloom in parks and along the Jeker River, pleasant time for walking tours and outdoor cafés
Easter markets at Vrijthof Square, special church services at the Basilica of Saint Servatius, special brunches at restaurants
The start of the celebrated Limburg white asparagus season with special menus at local restaurants
Peak spring weather, flowers blooming throughout the Jekerkwartier and along the Maas River, ideal for walking tours
Citywide celebrations with street parties, orange outfits, and free markets throughout Maastricht
Beautiful spring weather continues, outdoor café culture thrives around Vrijthof and Markt squares
Public holiday with events in the city center
May 4th (Remembrance Day) and May 5th (Liberation Day) commemorations with ceremonies
Perfect spring conditions, outdoor activities in full swing, excellent time for exploring the city
Religious celebration honoring Maastricht's patron saint with special ceremonies at the Basilica and religious processions
Spring version of Maastricht's famous culinary festival featuring seasonal specialties and outdoor dining at Vrijthof
Peak season for the region's celebrated white asparagus, featured in special menus throughout the city
Early summer weather, excellent for outdoor activities and exploring the city
Celebration of local viticulture with tastings from nearby vineyards and culinary pairings
Riverside activities, boat tours, and outdoor dining along the Maas River
World-famous violinist's open-air concerts on Vrijthof Square; hotels book up far in advance
Peak summer weather, outdoor activities very popular in city parks and along the Maas River
Maastricht's largest culinary festival featuring food and drink from dozens of local restaurants and producers at Vrijthof Square
Late summer weather continues, student life resumes as university starts new academic year
Classical and contemporary music performances in historic venues throughout the city
Unique culinary event where guests move between different restaurants for each course of their meal
Autumn colors in Sint Pietersberg and city parks, pleasant temperatures, cultural season begins
Special evening when museums and cultural institutions open their doors after hours with special programs
Quieter tourism period, increasingly cooler weather, transition to indoor activities
Children's lantern processions and door-to-door singing in residential neighborhoods
Special guided tours and events highlighting the extensive network of caves and tunnels beneath the city
Traditional Dutch holiday celebration with Sinterklaas arriving in the city
Dutch pre-Christmas celebration with gift exchanges and special treats
Christmas market, ice skating rink, and festive decorations at Vrijthof Square; unique atmosphere in the historic city
Most businesses close by afternoon, special services at the Basilica of Saint Servatius, special dining at hotels and restaurants
Public holidays, most businesses closed, special church services and quiet atmosphere with limited dining options
Nearby town of Valkenburg hosts unique Christmas markets in marl caves, accessible by short trip from Maastricht
Celebrations centered around Vrijthof Square with fireworks and festivities

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
